Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: A family member flew in for Labor Day weekend and wanted to stay on the beach. It is impossible to find for just two nights in high season a reputable chain hotel unles you stay in Salisbury. I knew that to be able to only book for that Saturday and Sunday nights there might be a few problems. Most of the bad reviews I had read were correct. The carpets and furnishings were well worn and the hallways did smell of urine. They do have luggage carts, however when you take the small elevator to the upper floors you cannot push it to your room as there are many up and down stairs on each level. We asked the front desk for help and they did send the maintenance man who knew how to get the cart to our room and he even took everything off and placed our luggage in our room. In the rooms you could see mold in various places, so if someone is a germaphobe beware. However, the front desk staff was extremely nice and helpful and you are steps away from the beach. So to be able to be oceanside for only a weekend in high season I would say it was worth our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a typical beach hotel with friendly staff at the very end of the board. Great beach location. Value for our efficiency was awesome. They have showers and change rooms so u can continue use of beach & pool before & after check in/ check out. Board walk was quiet and was walking distance to some good restaurants and family activities. My only complaint is house keeping did not replenish towels/ toiletries to my liking. Had to keep asking for extra towels, shampoo, toilet paper and dish soap. Parking that was near hotel was very tight too.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE.”
Reviews.Author: mzjodee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and everything was very nice and clean. staff was friendly. Only problem was no blankets on the bed which they were more than happy to bring to our room when we asked.Free tanning bed, gym, indoor pool and hot tub was nice. Every staff member I spoke to was very nice and and helpful. Pool side bar and music was nice while relaxing at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get your hopes up too high”
Reviews.Author: destep
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was pretty good, depending on what your after. The beach was steps away and the amusement park was also close. The pier rides and arcades were at the opposite end but there was a tram that went the stretch of the boardwalk. As for the room, I'm sure it was clean but it felt kind of dirty. The water pressure in the shower was really poor. You could get more pressure from the sink and considering that most people are trying to rinse off sand from the beach this was disappointing. There was only one elevator in the building so depending on where your room was, you might be walking pretty far to get from the elevator to the room. I gave this rating an average because it wasn't disgusting but it also wasn't worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation....14 adults, 5 kids, 5 rooms”
Reviews.Author: pam h
Reviews.Content: this was our first stay at the Flagship..we usually stayed an another efficiency hotel on the bayside but this year decided we needed a family based hotel on the beachside...we were very pleased with our choice....we will definitely go back next year....there was alot to do at the hotel...it was very nice, perfect size for 4 people...very clean...close to everything...the reviews that ive been reading that are bad seem like spoiled rotten people that are high n mighty too good for all hotels comments actually.!!!! this hotel had the most accomodating staff working for them that ive ever seen....they were always cleaning, and picking up after all the guests 24/7...the hotel is alittle older than others but clean, fun, and the lobby DID always have fruit, coffee, tea, hot chocolate at no charge....we cant wait to go back next year and we are going to try to stay longer this time...my kids and grandkids feel the same way too...glad we chose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great time!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelly m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to have a renewal of our vows on the beach! We chose this hotel because it was on the boardwalk but away from all the crowds. I'm so glad we did. When I made my reservation they were so nice and answered all of my 100 questions. Then when I arrived the front desk clerk Kate and the manager Lori were super nice. They let us into our room early and even moved their car so we could have a close parking spot!!!! =) The entire staff went out of their way to be friendly and I really appreciate that. This is an older hotel and they have renovated part of it. It was worth the stay just to have a respectful and friendly staff. They have an indoor pool that is open all night, a hot tub and tanning bed! They have recently added more activities to thier courtyard...overall we had a wonderful time!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Childless, clean adults Do not go here!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: I walked in and refused to sit even in the lobby. Chairs were stained and looked suspicious. I walked the hall to my room as urine smell hit me in the face. I opened the door and my face dropped immediately. I then did my usual bedbug test and they did pass that, however the room was covered in mold and the sheets were a dingy yellow. I spent more at the bed bath beyond buying sheets, pillows and cleaning products then I would have if I had stayed at a much much better hotel. After buying my own sheets and making the room somewhat tolerable, I walked through the pool area which was saturated with diapered and naked babies. Again, the smell of urine hit me in the face. I waited for the babies to go to bed hoping the pool would be cleaned by 10pm, nope! I put my hand in and my hand smelled of pee, so I forgot about the pool and went to splash mountain the next day instead. The housekeeper was really nice and so were the front desk people, but the place....its awful! Adult , childless couples who want sanitary conditions ....DO NOT GO HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation 8/20/12-Great Week!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda C
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews I read, I was very nervous to stay at this hotel, but I'm glad I did! We had a wonderful time and the hotel was great. The front desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff were very nice and helpful! We had a great room with a great view, it may have been a little small, but we weren't in the room much anyway; it was great to wake up and see the dolphins in the ocean!! There was always fruit and coffee in the morning. Our room was steps to the beach/ocean and being at the end of the Boardwalk, there was not too much commotion. The Riptide Bar had great food and frozen drinks. Yes there was a smell in the hallways, but you are right above a seafood restaurant, what do you expect! It did not bother us. Great location and we will stay there again!! I hope this helps other travelers! Thanks so much Flagship!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled By The Pictures On The Website”
Reviews.Author: Bradley G
Reviews.Content: Based on the pictures on the website and the price of the room, I thought I was going to be staying at a very nice hotel. I was wrong. I should have read the reviews on here first. From the moment I stepped in the front doors I had a bad feeling about this place. The staff wasn't very welcoming and acted like it was an inconvenience for us to be there. The elevator is tiny. The hallways and our room smelled like pee. Upon notifying the manager of this smell, he said that he could not verify it. There are several other reviewers who also mentioned this smell. The room was a lot smaller than they make it look in the picture. The coffee in the lobby was decent but there was never any fruit in the mornings. The Wifi internet was horrible (when it even worked) Out of the 4 or 5 wifi hotspots around the hotel, I could never get better than 1 bar of signal. I couldnt connect to the internet half of the time either. The riptide bar was pretty cool but it closed way too early. This hotel is a good location right on the boardwalk, but thats about all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Flagship stay was great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! We used it for a family vacation with two young children. The beachfront location is excellent with the outdoor pool facing the ocean. Additionally, we were pleased to see a pirate ship play area for young children in the courtyard. The service was impressive and we are already planning to stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patti419
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have been going to the Flagship for now 5 years. We have experienced so much fun.They have indoor and outdoor pool, an excerise room, a suntan bed, a bar outside . Its a great place to stay rooms are real nice, and the staff are excellent, Scotty is very personable and he will do anything to make your stay great, We love this hotel we will always stay here when we visit OCMD. thank you Flagship.

Reviews.Title: “2012 OC FAMILY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen J
Reviews.Content: This was a well needed family vacation and the perfect place to rest my toes in the sand!! The hotel was very warm and inviting! The staff was magnificant!! Anytime I needed something extra the staff always delivered! The room was clean, bathroom was clean, the breakfast fruit was deliscious!! I will always stay at this affordable ocean front hotel!! I was a joy to have such a wonderful childrens area and tables for picnics, beachfront pool, and a beachfront bar and grill. The food was great, staff was friendly, and all guest seemed to be having a wonderful time!! I suggest this hotel if you want to stay at and affordable price with quality!! The desk managers are wonderful and very responsive to your needs!!!!!!!! Its a winner!! If I could give 6 stars I would!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nbeach120
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a pleasant place to stay. First, the parking is a nightmare! They do not have enough parking spaces. The elevator is very small and the hallways are very narrow. The hallways have a strong nasty odor and the rooms are not very clean. The shower in the room had very little water pressure. The hotel has a U-shape so you are actually far from the ocean and have a side view. The balconies are not private and there is only a small metal railing between the balconies of each room. The inside pool was so dirty that I would not let my children swim in it. We definately would NOT stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible right from the start!”
Reviews.Author: Mary0820
Reviews.Content: I understand you read reviews to get a sense of what kind of hotel you're booking....what to expect, what other people have experienced, etc. So let me save you some time please as there is no need to read any further. As a wife and mother of two, who works two jobs, all we wanted was a much needed nice vacation. Instead, upon entering the lobby of the flagship, we encountered a nasty, undescribable smell and it all went downhill from there. The one elevator was so tiny. The hallways, again, tiny and narrow. When the maid service cart was in the hallway, we couldn't walk past. The windows in the hallways were filthy, sills dirty as well. Hallways smelled horrible too. Everything is so dark. Indoor pool was dirty. There is a seafood restaurant under the hotel but it wasnt even a fishy smell i dunno, just really gross...Our room was small, not at all like the pictures on the website. The carpets were stained badly. The bed linens had holes in them. The balcony was dirty with the previous vacationers garbage on it and the floor of balcony was not swept. Seven months prior to our stay we reserved 2nd or 3rd floor oceanfront. They gave us room 101. We fussed, so they said stay in 101 then move to another room next day. How about this, how about keeping people's reservations and not stink up their whole vacation? LITERALLY! Please save your family's vacation and book elsewhere! When they messed up our reservation we left and went to another hotel. Suffice to say we will never ever stay at the flagship again. One night was more than enough. I hope they paid their professional photographer big bucks who made the hotel look so nice online. He/she is super talented! Book elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “ocean city 2012”
Reviews.Author: rita w
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel rooms were redone and were clean staff was very friendly, great views from courtyard and ocean front easy acess to tram pools were clean and playyard was nice ,, great layout with lobby on first floor gameroom on second floor andalarge sitting area on the third floor with aflat screen tv. after check out accomedations were great. dont believe peoples bad reviews, this was a great hotel to stay at.keep up the great work scott.

Reviews.Title: “HICKS FAMILY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen H
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful friendly staff that attend to all of your needs! All rooms are ocean front which makes every room wonderful. The room was clean, fresh fruits available in the lobby all day, ocean front pool is wonderful to enjoy the sounds and view of the ocean while keeping the sand on the beach, and the food at the hotels bar/restuarant is excellent! What a wonderful place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BandBJr
Reviews.Content: We take regular trips to Ocean City and wanted to try a different hotel. We booked a room at the Flagship and were very happy with our choice. Our room was clean and ready even though we arrived 2 hours before check in. Each time I saw a staff member they would stop and ask if we needed anything. I have recommended this hotel to friends who have also had a great time. We're going back in September and we're looking forward to another good time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay some place elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: suziJerseyCity
Reviews.Content: A bit late on this review, anyways our trip was from 7/16-7/19, picked this hotel because it was right on beach and boardwalk. arrived about 3 pm and room was ready, 1st floor, walked in, totally not what we expected, smelled like cigarette, called down to reception, ask for another room, said we could switch next door, didnt bother, a custodian came and cleaned the walls. Even though the hotel lists all the room as OCEANVIEW, only a couple of rooms near the beach was ok, the others seemed like it was in the distance. It was an efficiency but we did not use, I think the price was too high also. only good things are the hot tub, outdoor pool and the fresh fruits in the lobby. the restaurant on site was excellent, highly recommend. The hotel needs lots of cleaning and updating, rugs in room and hallways smelled horrible, mattress needs to replace, entrance from the beach seemed scary, as anyone can walk in from the outside, did not use the laundry facilities. only the maids were friendly, they cleaned and give extra supplies, asked some questions at the front desk, no one knows, night before departure asked to stay 2 more nights, price was ok but then we had to move every night and so we didn’t bother. I agree with the other reviewers, stay some place elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to bring your bleach!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cassidy L
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves a zero. The hallways smelled of urine, carpets were badly stained, balcony was filthy, the bedding had holes in it, and the windows were dirty. My family could barely fit in the elevator with our luggage. The staff members were really rude. Don't think since you reserved your hotel room your going to get it. The staff was just horrible. The bathrooms were unbelievable! I recommend to bring your cleaning supplies. Our hotel room was just overall filthy! i highly do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone unless they want to clean on vacation.Overall, i would NEVER stay here again!!!!!! Instead, check out the grand hotel! For a little more money it's worth it! You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't do this to your family!”
Reviews.Author: sam j
Reviews.Content: First off, don't get fooled by the pictures on their site...especially the one of the boardwalk with the pier in the background...it's on the other end of the boardwalk and you could never see that from there. Anyway, we made our reservation in January for a July stay. I called to make sure we were getting a 2nd or 3rd floor oceanfront efficency and was assured that everything was all set up. We arrived a day early, got a room for one night and then our oceanfront room for the rest of the week. That place is the worst. It smells, the one elevator that they have is the size of a closet, and the hallways are so narrow that we could not push our luggage cart past the maid's cart. The room was very outdated and the floors were stained with who knows what. The bedding was very old and the mattresses were probably the original ones from the grand opening. It was one of those situations where you didn't want to look around because of what you might see. Most of the video games in the game room didn't work and the indoor pool looked kinda murky. There are different steps in different places throughout the upper floors on the north side of the building so if you end up with a room over there...you will be carrying all of your luggage...because the carts will be useless. They have 3 or 4 parking lots but they are not really convenient and one of them is on the other side of the main street. The next day, although we were very disappointed overall, we decided to stick it out...hoping that our oceanfront efficiency would be nicer. Well, they didn't have the room we reserved in January. They offered us a 1st floor oceanfront...that had plexiglass covering the balcony...so we would have to look through it to see the ocean. Then the following day they said that they may be able to get us into the room we reserved in January. I almost blew a gasket and instead demanded my deposit back. I got a refund and we left, finding another hotel, a place I wasn't afraid to take my shoes off in and walk around. Don't waste your money. Give your famlly a nice vacation. They deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Sucks!!!! Book your hotel somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erica A
Reviews.Content: The hotel ranks a zero! Hotel is very dated. The smell in the hallways was disgusting. It smelled like urine. The beds were horrible to sleep in. You could feel the springs through the bedding. There was hair from a previous vacationer in the bathroom. The lights worked intermittently in the hotel room and the railing on the balcony was missing bolts. The refrigerator froze all of our food and the housekeeping staff was awful. House keeping only emptied trash and I actually had one housekeeping person hand me the toilet paper to change the roll in the downstairs public bathroom!!! There was no shower at the pool level to rinse off after coming in off the beach. The gameroom equipment was broke half the time. Beware, you will be climbing the stairs alot. There is only 1 tiny elevator for the entire hotel. The pool was the only nice part and the music that the bar staff played ruined that! My children wanted to leave the day we arrived. My kids were scared to stay there. This place was definitely along the lines of a motel. If I expected motel standards, I would have booked a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you have standards..if not then go for it..u were warned!”
Reviews.Author: Breathless01
Reviews.Content: This hotels shares the standards of a motel in terms of overall condition. The lobby, hallways, floors, and bedding are dingy and dated. Honestly I didn't want to even sleep under the covers but having served as a female in the Army, my basic survival skills kicked in. The room was as clean as it can be. Hairs were found on the shower curtains. The tub is the tiniest I've ever seen. Its my birthday so I figured I go for the cheaper beachfront since I wouldn't spend much time in the room. But it was chilly so I turned in early. Overall its the equivalent of staying in the "Red Light District."Our doors chain was pulled from the wall and hanging on the door and there didn't appear to be much security as anyone could walk off the beach into the first floor side entrance where the rooms are. I have standards when it comes to hotels...but this time I sacrificed for the least expensive since its only one night...Oh how I could kick my own self in the you know where..I'm sorry I wouldn't recommend to anyone with children or anyone with standards and expectations. Pay the extra money or stay home...

Reviews.Title: “Gross. Can't believe I paid over $500 to stay at this dump.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzymiller
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel needs a good cleaning; the hallways smell like pee. The shower curtains are disgusting. The only good thing was the out side pool (the inside one was gross) and location was great. Ewe!

Reviews.Title: “OCMD 2012”
Reviews.Author: NEPA0814
Reviews.Content: Had an oceanfront room 3rd floor. The outdoor pool is very nice. Their is a person keeping non guests out of the pool from the bar next to pool. indoor pool is a good option for kids. Great location at the end of the boardwalk. great all you can eat seafood rest. in hotel. The hotel and rooms were very clean and had nice staff. Now the resort is an older building its not a new hotel but neither is 90% of ocean city. Its a good beachfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run away. Now!”
Reviews.Author: Lse1313
Reviews.Content: The location is good and the room is clean. But...The mattresses are so old that you can feel and hear the springs, and they are the smallest doubles I have ever seen. The rest of the room was old and outdated but I can live with that. The bathroom was barely big enough to call tiny. The ocean view I paid for can only be seen if looking over an hvac fan and ugly courtyard--only if you are standing. So don't expect to sit on your balcony and enjoy the view. The parking is atrocious--you need to be a stunt driver to get in and out if some of the spots, and there are so many steps to go up and down just to stay on the same floor (it's hard to explain) that you can't use a cart to bring your luggage in. I could go on....

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at the Flagship Oceanfront Hotel Ocean City MD”
Reviews.Author: Denny2696
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Flagship Hotel in Ocean City and again we had great time. The staff there are great especially Scot who is THE MAN! We went there again this year as we had went there the year before and had a great time and were treated above and beyond! So just letting people know if you are looking for a hotel in Ocean City make sure you check them out.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: kate h
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in their courtyard rooms and the view was gorgeous! The staff was so welcoming and nice. Everyone spoke when they would see us such a change from other hotels we have been too! They have an indoor pool that was open all night so I was able to take my nieces down at 11pm and let them play while my mom and I relaxed on the lounge chairs. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable...I just really enjoyed my stay and can't wait to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location! Needs better management!”
Reviews.Author: Goksroo
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good, boardwalk is outside and easy access to beach. Pancake house and all u can eat buffet is just outside hotel which was great. Price was ok, paid 139 plus tax for each night, stay was from Sunday to wednesday, thought price should be cheaper for weekday but it wasn't. Our negative comments are....we came early and asked if we can check in and was told to come back for 3 pm, we came back at 3:40 pm and room was not ready, room key did not work, had to get new ones. Sheets were not changed and bed not made up next morning. Balcony was never cleaned entire stay. Had to put bed against wall for baby, that bed was never made up entire stay. They need to have someone look over cleaning staff work so they do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: curlytb
Reviews.Content: I had my concerns about staying this close to the boardwalk- I believe that the closer to the boardwalk, the scummier the accomodations. However, my friend and I decided pretty last minute (about 10 days before) to go to OC for Memorial day weekend. Flagship had the least expensive oceanview room, so I booked it. The front desk staff was friendly, even when we had a small dispute (I thought we booked oceanfront, but when I reviewed the reservation, it did indeed say oceanview). The rooms were cleaned promptly every day, and the staff was courteous. Clearly this is no Marriott, but for a budget hotel on the boardwalk with an ocean view, it was suprisingly good. There was also a live reggae band that played each afternoon (not sure if that was just for Mem day wknd), so that added to the fun atmosphere. The pool and pool bar were packed and lively every afternoon with a younger crowd (early-mid 20s). There were also a lot of amenities that make it a good deal- game room with 80's video games like Ms Pacman, and they only cost 25 cents, just like the good old days. Inexpensive vending machine, indoor and outdoor pools, gym, playground, coffee and fruit in the lobby. Aside from a bulb in the ceiling light that was out, everything was functional in the room, and the balcony was large with 2 chairs and a table. For a no frills, fun experience, this place is it.

Reviews.Title: “2 nice weeks”
Reviews.Author: connie o
Reviews.Content: it was so nice there and i really didnt want to leave the hotelmanger is a very nice guy(scott) and some of the cleaning crew was super nice and friendly we have a super time there the whole 2 weeks and cant wait to go again

Reviews.Title: “Mothers Day Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mary O
Reviews.Content: The Flagship was an AWESOME place to stay! The staff was so very friendly and very, very helpful especially Scott. The hotel is right on the beach! Fresh fruit and coffee served all day. It has an indoor and outdoor pool and a really cute ship on a sand playground for kids to enjoy. The view from our room was spectacular and the room has a stove and a refrigerator. The hotel is very clean and close to everything. My Mother and I came for a relaxing Mother's Day Getaway. It was everything we wanted and more:) We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tsizzle415
Reviews.Content: This was my first vacation in seven years and I was more then happy with this hotel and all of its staff. Everyone treated us very well and made sure everything we needed was taken care of. If you are looking for somewhere to stay where all you have to do is sit back relax and enjoy yourself then this is the hotel for you. Its also kid friendly and has indoor and outdoor pools as well as a jacuzzi and workout room and tanning bed and playground for the kids and it is just a few steps from the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: I came in friday untill Sunday morning...friday check in was great ...after that the hell begain....coffee pot and lamps in room didnt work...works playing around on the front desk floor ....then they were runing gas powered tools so the smell of gas would be bad,,alll day Sat ..then 530 am works were out side in the area they were doing the work talking loud so up sunday at 530 we were,,,all and all if ur looking for loud places and old rooms its for you,,,,on lady waited 1 hr to return her door key ...got mad becouse no one would answer her calls .....sad ....

Reviews.Title: “With hundreds of other options, I would not chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgdc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was affordable, and a good location. The room was fine, the 'updated' room was pretty out of date. The bed wasn't very comfortable. You get what you pay for, I guess, even though off season rates were $100 a night for a Thu-Fri. We liked the location, and the indoor pool was nice for kids. Our biggest complaint is the staff. We did not get maid service while we were there, and when I mentioned this to the front desk, they looked at me with total disdain, like it wasn't their problem. Incredibly rude. There are hundreds of places in OC to stay, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “completely worth it.”
Reviews.Author: erikahjames
Reviews.Content: stayed here in april in ocean front. paid 394 for thurs to mon checkout. great access to boardwalk and beach. extremely friendly and helpful service. 2 bdrm efficiency is perfect size and accommodating. the front desk guy, scott, really made our entire stay. clean, awesome, come stay here!

Reviews.Title: “April break”
Reviews.Author: Sandyglid
Reviews.Content: The room and service was fine. The access to the room was terrible. Elevator up but then steps up then down before you can reach your room. Carrying heavy suitcases all the way. Won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Excellent location, a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: goodeye2
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday 9/24 at noon of Sun Fest weekend and were immediately checked in and taken to our room. The room was neat and clean although the hotel is a bit worn and walls are thin. The location is great, staff was nice and complimentary laundry. Nice feature when you have been vacationing. Balcony was nice and although some guests can be loud that is not the fault of the hotel. On the end of the Boardwalk, so quiet but bike rentals right outside door. Prices were reasonable considering an event weekend. Hot tub nice but not open until 10 AM while pool is 24 hours?

Reviews.Title: “love the beach”
Reviews.Author: beachparty1
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we stayed at nthe Flagship oceanfront. The location is really good for the tram car, view is incredible and hotel has great amenities, including indoor and outdoor pools. My 4 year old nephew loved the courtyard with the sandbox and indoor kiddie pool. Definitely would make this our yearly vacation choice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable - Location, Amenities & Price all good!”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Not a five star, and it is an older property, but the combination of location, amenities, price and nice staff make it a winner for our family. We've stayed here four times and plan on coming back. At the end of the boardwalk, nice beach and beach access, pools ( in & out), pool bar, hot tub, exercise room all bonuses for us! A true value!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: wlmlatb1
Reviews.Content: There was an awful musty/moldy smell in our room (#220) from the first day we walked in. Supposably there were no other rooms available. We used a whole can of air freshener during our 3 day stay. The spray would only mask it for a while but each time we left the room and came back the smell was there again. Really didn't like staying at the at that end of the boardwalk either. The only good thing about it was the price. So that old saying "You get what you pay for" is true. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would of rather slept in my car.”
Reviews.Author: himi13
Reviews.Content: My first instinct on the hotel was not too bad seeing as it was a girls trip and we were just looking to have fun. The rooms were alright, not as good as they should be for what I paid. The bathrooms are absolutley disgusting, thinking the last time they were renovated were the 70's. The first night we awoke to glass shattering in the hallway. Somebody busted the fire extinguisher case. The next few nights cosnsisted of people knocking on our door at every hour of the night and running, and even having someone climb onto our balcony (they are all connected- NOT SAFE). Not what I wanted to wake up to at 3 a.m. But the hotel assured us not to call the cops, they had it taken care of. Yeah, since it continued all night and they did nothing. To top our trip off we had over $100 stolen from our locked room on the last day. But no cameras available in the hallway to check on this so nothing could be done. Not to mention the manager is not friendly and should not work with the public. Save yourself the trouble and stay at the holiday inn!

Reviews.Title: “loved it cant wait to do it again”
Reviews.Author: connie o
Reviews.Content: i loved the hotel. the only thing i didnt like is the walk from the elavator half way around the hotel with my luaggage. we stayed a week and im booking 2 weeks this time. so we can stay longer. it was clean friendly and i have told everyone its the place to stay and right on boardwalk cant wait to get back

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Sunsparkles23
Reviews.Content: Pros: good rates for being on the boardwalk, service was excellent, pool and bar were nice along with the free fruit in the lobby. Cons: we booked a limited view room thinking the limited view woul be a side room since the hotel is a sq. Wrong! The limited view room was behind the rip tide bar and next to fans from Jonah and the well. We were on the right side looking toward the ocean and the hallway and room smelled like fish and when you turned on the air it only got worse. I also woke up at 3 am to find "Waterbugs" as the front desk would put it in my bathroom as I googles this I found out this is a nice way of saying cochroaches needless to say we were moved to another room on the other side of the building at 4 in the am to find 2 sets of 3 stairs in order to get to our room. We then spoke to the manager in the am and were able o stay in the non infested room. Overal the staff was accommodating and the 2nd room was not bad for the price ( from what I get from reading reviews and being a guest some rooms are renovated and some are not)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for its price !”
Reviews.Author: jaybirde63
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for the day following "Irene"and an additional 2 nights !! The hotel opened @noon (due to the storm) & we arrived @ 3pm .After a 3 hour drive we were glad to see,our room was all ready ,the indoor pool was open (24hrs) as was the hot tub(10a-10p) ! We had an Ocean View room With 2 queen beds ,that had a great view of the ocean ,and the hotel is located right on the Board Walk ,which was great ,All the staff were excellent and very helpfull .This hotel is not new but the rooms were fine for the price.there are 3 steps in the front hall but the staff will drop off and pick up your bags if needed (we did not need their help) The rooms were very clean as were the beds. The furniture was not brand new but was in very good condition.The AC worked GREAT!! We will come back !!! P.S. the outdoor pool opened up on our 2nd day after the storm NICE & CLEANED!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the amount charged the room and overall facility should be in better condition”
Reviews.Author: BTHood99
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the third floor ocean view room. The view was absolutely beautiful but, the room could use many repairs: No exhaust in the bathroom, draperies broken on all the windows and sliding glass door, the mattresses like marshmallows, chain lock on door broken off, closet door off its track. The furnishings battered and old. Only one parking space per room-spaces are very close together. The hotel staff were extremely nice and very helpful. The air conditioning unit broke one night at 10:30 pm and the maintenance man showed up at our room with in a few minutes and stayed until it was fixed-he was technically off duty. I would only stay here again if repairs and upgrades were made and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a girls weekend. EXCELLENT location.”
Reviews.Author: lashero
Reviews.Content: I visited the Flagship for a girls weekend. We're a pretty laid back group, aren't too hard to please and are just looking for a stress-free weekend w/o having to take care of our kids. We loved the location of the hotel. It's on the very end of the boardwalk. The staff is also very kind & attentive. We requested some extra towels & needed sheets for a pull-out sofa bed; both requests were dealt with quickly & courteously even though we were a late arrival & it was close to 11pm. The front desk staff was also a group of pretty enjoyable people to talk to. Every interaction was positive. Another positive: our rooms were very clean. I hate to give the Flagship an 'average' rating because we did have such a fun weekend, but the hotel is dated. Our bathroom looked very "70's era" (which is why I was so impressed by how clean they were!) The rooms are damp & everything smells a bit musty. Our entire party came home w/ sore throats & various other cold-type symptoms that cleared up w/in about 24 hrs after we left. I think they might have some mold spore problems. We paid a bit over $300 a night for a 2 room efficiency during the height of the in-season. (The bedroom had a double bed & the living room area had a pull out sofabed.) I felt that the price was a little steep for the quality of the rooms' furnishings. The flagship doesn't have a lot of parking. Because we arrived so late, we did have to park in a lot that was alittle less than a block away. Fortunately there were still some spaces available for us. On the plus side: We did see security cameras in the lot. For my party only being there for a weekend the parking was not a big deal, but again, it would've been a big inconvenience had I had my family. The walls are thin & you are able to hear a lot of noise from the hallway. For our girls weekend, the flagship was great, but I'm not sure I would have been as happy with the room had I been traveling with my husband & children.

Reviews.Title: “we not like this hotel it was dirty”
Reviews.Author: koifish2011
Reviews.Content: this hotel rating on this for me is 1 star, because the front is look good but the inside was smell and dirty, hallway too small. if next time i come down here i choose grand hotel is better. I was read about flagship hotel on this trip advisor, but someone did not give the true about this hotel. My family very disappointed at this flagship hotel. research before you book this hotel. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but..........”
Reviews.Author: Beatletoons
Reviews.Content: I was debating whether to give this hotel a 2 or a 3 star review. I went with 3 but let's discuss. First, the good things: the room was nice enough, the view was great. We had a side view room on the 3rd floor, the renovated deluxe. Balcony was large and beautiful all day with a nice breeze which felt refreshing! The hotel is located on 26th street and is at the end of the boardwalk but at the beginning of the Tram Service which is a big plus when you want to go to the "real part of the boartdwalk." The service was great. Stafff VERY friendly with no complaints here from us at all. Very accomodating. Some of the bad, and they are bad! First, the parking absolutely STINKS. Small lot and a supplemental lot. Other than that, you have to get a spot on the side streets. GOOD LUCK!!! Also, our room was 306 and we went up the elevator with teh luggage cart full of our stuff only to find STEPS!! Yes, steps up (three of them) an dthen the hallway, then 3 more steps down and then another hallway. How the heck were we supposed to get the full cart up and down just to get to our room. The staff politely told us that it was only on one sid eo fteh building. To their credit, they DID offer a new room on the other side but THE NEXT DAY. We told them we didn't want to move after getting settled in since the room was fine. They sadi no problem with getting help when we check out. True to their word, we didn't have to go up any steps when checking out. The bell hops were great and did it for us but it was a pain!!! The inddor pool was a joke, so small!!! Although it was open 24/7 so you could take a quiet dip any hour of the night! Outdoor pool was nice! Fruit and coffe/hot chocolate any time of day was a nice touch too. Even though we had a non-smoking room, it DID smell a tiny bit of smoke. Don't know if that was from other rooms on the floor which allowed smoking or not! Showere water pressure was bad. For the price we paid a night, nearly $227 a nite, it was okay and we expected a lot more in terms of room comforts, etc but it WAS the heart of the season for Ocean City so I guess I would have paid a lot more per night at a more luxurious place. All in all, not a bad place but do your homework. You may want to stay at a hotel further down the boardwalk like between 2nd and 16th streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great View extremely Clean.”
Reviews.Author: Tealwombat
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the bad reviews for this hotel, I became really nervous after my mother told me that was where she booked her room for our family vacation. My husband and I booked an Efficiency with a King Sized Bed. The rates were pretty reasonable for peak season (July 29-31). On the way to the hotel my mother received a call from the hotel stating that there had been some matience issues and they were unable to use the room, but they were offering them a free upgrade to the Quality Inn on 16th. My mother wanted us all to stay together so the hotel accommodated us and moved someone else. Upon entering the staff was friendly, the lobby, indoor heated pool, and the jacuzzi were all clean. We stayed in room 230 on the second floor. The room was spotless and newly renovated. The hallway outside of our room smelled like trash , but we were located directly above the Jonah and the Whale dumpsters and as long as it didn't enter our room I didn't care. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the mattress was new! Our balcony was gigantic and it was located right on the end of a row of rooms. SO when you walked out you literally had the best view of the beach. We spent most of our time on the balcony watching the ocean, it was beautiful. If I knew we could come back and get that room I would absolutely return. My mothers room was on the opposite side of the hotel and it was not renovated. I think a lot of the bad reviews are for the non renovated rooms. If you do plan on staying here bring your own pillows, theirs were definately need of replacement. We had never been to OC before so we were not sure where our hotel played in the scheme of things. I did not like how we were located at the end of the boardwalk and had to hoof it to get to m

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: creationzbykim
Reviews.Content: Very nice place and the staff was very accomodating! We had ocean front and were located overlooking the pirate playground and pool which was ok but there were up front ocean front rooms closer to the beach!! We had a nice view but we stayed an extra night and they moved us up right on ocean front!! That was a NICE view! Will go back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing clean get away and AMERICAN owned, a rarity”
Reviews.Author: spiritednspunky
Reviews.Content: Almost cancelled our vacation due to all the bed bug reviews, all of the Harrison family hotels rated no bugs hurray! Clean, and staff was very accomidating. My sister has asthma and is sensitive to dust and mold, no problems! On my way back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mommysgal
Reviews.Content: The place was convenient and off the main course of traffic. The staff was very considerate and nice. The hotel goes out of their way to stay clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! :-D”
Reviews.Author: Petra_Krolik
Reviews.Content: Right on the Boardwalk, at the north/cleaner/quieter end. Clean room, new very comfortable beds, wi-fi, fridge, mircrowave, coffee machine, outdoor and indoor pool, (indoor pool is open 24/7!), helpful staff, elevator, (great, as it's four floors!). It was our first visit to Ocean City and Assateague Island National Seashore. A great time, which was augmented by this very nice and conveniently located hotel. We will be back! :-D

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!!! Thanks Scott! :)”
Reviews.Author: kittykat61110
Reviews.Content: We had a great time thanks to Scott, the manager, he was awesome. He went out of his way to make us as comfortable as possible all of the time. The only complaint i have is parking, there wasnt really any good parking, but other than that I loved the hotel, and the outdoor pool was great too. Thanks Scott!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected and Will Return Next Time in OC”
Reviews.Author: JRP-4H
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was not sure what we were in for when we reserved the room on the boardwalk. The good points: You are on the boardwalk, right on the beach, beach was not packed, balcony offers an ocean view, rooms are clean, staff is nice, staff will make sure your happy with your stay and the cost is affordable without losing quality. Something to consider while there is to rent the "Family Bikes" in the morning. They have them next door and is a fun family bonding experience and a way to see the boardwalk in the morning to plan out the day/night. The areas of improvement or of note: The restaurant (Johan's) was not the best and we will probably not eat there again, while on the boardwalk you are at the end of it and will need to take the tram down to shop/eat/play and bring your own pillow as ones in the room are clean but have little fluffy left. In summary, next time I head to OC, I will be staying at the Flagship.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place for folks on a budget”
Reviews.Author: robstac
Reviews.Content: This is our third year staying at Flagship. The location is perfect, has great pool on the beach and indoor for the rain days to occupy the kids. All employees, Michelle, Paul, and housekeeping were friendly and helpful. If you are looking for upscale luxury this is not it ....... but awesome for what you pay for. Clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “ill be back in the words of arnold scwarzenegger”
Reviews.Author: nellly1
Reviews.Content: it is the only hotel on the beachfront that has emtertainment and fun .... i truly recommend it ,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: bawalker63
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my friends and I have stayed here. I love the location, waking up and sitting on the balcony to people watch and listen to the ocean waves is just amazing! Being right at the end of the boardwalk is convenient (we were out of the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk down the boardwalk). We get a side ocean-front room. Many other hotels want upwards of $300 per night for an ocean-front hotel. We paid a little less than $200 per night. The staff is very nice. The woman who cleaned our room was very nice and even went out of her way to get us extra towels, trash bags, etc. The rooms are a little small, but we're always doing something so were rarely there. All-in-all, you can't beat the view for the price, the staff was nice and helpful. We will most likely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bring some air freshener and an open mind if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: kalnix
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked in the lobby, the musty smell was overwhelming. From what I know now, historically this was the 2nd hotel built in the area....and i don't think they changed much since then. Staff was very nice...but that is ablout all that was nice. Outdoor pool was decent and had a great view of the beach. But the inside of the hotel was gross. Narrow hallways, tiny bathrooms, indoor pool and hot tub were cloudy and dirty. We stayed with a group and had about 10 rooms. ALL of them reeked of smoke and mildew...even the ones that were supposedly non-smoking. Most of our friends left after the first night and forfeited their 2nd day of $ just so they didn't have to stay there another night.

Reviews.Title: “We really had a great stay at the flagship June 2011”
Reviews.Author: krbecker1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Ocean city, our stay at the Flagship was great. the staff were very friendly and helpful. My grand children are very young, the play area and pool were very clean and well maintained. Free washer and dryer was available for guest to use. This was also very helpful when traveling with young children. Thank you to the staff for making our stay enjoyable. we will return next year!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at the Flagship- Will return”
Reviews.Author: Denny2696
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Flagship Oceanfront. Myself along with 12 other friends went to Ocean City, Maryland to do an anual fishing excursion for four days. When we attempted to find rooms it was very difficult as many of the hotels were sold out. I did happen upon the Flagship Oceanfront and spoke with their group dorector, Sonja who was very accomadating and went out of her way to help me schedule the reservations. The hotel is older but is currently under renovations and we were given numerous rooms on the third floor all of which had been completly renovated. All the rooms had an ocean view and a fridge, microwave and coffeee maker which was convenient. They have a nice outdoor pool and bar which looks onto the boardwalk. They also have an indoor pool. What really makes this property is the staff as they are so friendly and cannot do enough for you. Michelle on the front desk and her co-workers are fantastic. We will be returning to Ocean City Maryland in the future and will be booking again at the Flagship Oceanfront. and you should also. Thanks Flagship for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Weekend Trip to the Beach”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTourista889
Reviews.Content: While it isn't the most aesthetic hotel in Ocean City, the Flagship Oceanfront provided a quiet weekend stay right on the end of the boardwalk. It seemed that every guest room offered a view of the courtyard swimming pool as well as the ocean and most were outfitted with a small balcony. Some rooms also had a small kitchenette and a refrigerator. The pool was very nice (they have both indoor and outdoor) as well as the bar right on the boardwalk attached to the hotel. Free parking and a very helpful staff were also a bonus. (They pointed us to a great place for breakfast in the morning called Happy Jack with every type of pancake imaginable and quick service so you can get to the beach!) That being said, the hotel could definitely use a few updates and modernizations since it looks like the last renovation was done in the 80's. They could also do with adding a few more security measures since there is no in-room safe and the balcony's are only separated by little fences that could easily be hopped over. Also the staff issued replacement keys to our room without asking for any form of personal ID which made us a little wary or how safe our valuables were in our room. All in all it was an acceptable hotel for a quick weekend at the beach, I would definitely look for something with a few more frills for a longer stay despite the incredible ocean view from the room!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: OcrN
Reviews.Content: My overall stay at flagship was pretty good..great location right at the end of the boardwalk, in and outdoor pool jacuzzi with a nice bar in "riptide" attached to the flagship..the rooms were pretty clean bathroom well kept and the maids were up to par with maintenance..I would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place.........”
Reviews.Author: Jojo1141298
Reviews.Content: I loved this place......the service there was wonderful, and the place is very clean. The night manager Scott was so good to us. We had a fire drill while we were there, and my husband was out at the time so I had to evacuate. I am partially handicapped and walk with a brace on my leg, so it is hard for me to get around, but Scott made sure I got out ok and later called to make sure I got back in ok. I was so impressed. He went way beyond what he had to do, and I appreciated it so much. We will definitely recommend this place to others. We also lost our bag with a good deal of money in it and when it was found, he made sure it got to me. The money was still there. He was amazing. He was the best hotel employee I have ever run across. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Was worried at first due to others reviews but it was GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: peachums24
Reviews.Content: When I first booked this hotel I was extremely worried it was going to be a very poor hotel due to the reviews some people left on this site. The room I first booked was getting renovations so the extremely nice manage Scott, apologized and gave us an even better room with the best view and knocked the price down. Our room was very clean; there was no rust on the toilet like stated in another review. Every time I went to OC MD I always stayed at the Princess Royal with my parents, so that is the type of hotel I am used to. But this hotel was very clean for me and I enjoyed it and so did my Boyfriend! We stayed on the third floor ocean front room and it was very nice and relaxing to sit on the balcony and enjoy the ocean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was clean, the staff was very nice and it was very affordable!! Loved it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Patti419
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Flagship in Ocean City. First the staff is outstanding and will help you feel comfortable and will do whatever they can to make you feel welcome and comfortable. The rooms are clean, and very comfortable. Michelle-Amanda-Sonjia-Jumior-Donna-Scott are the best they are like family when we come down. Its like coming home. They treat us like we are worth a million. Very Very nice hotel to stay at. They have an in-door pool as well as a huge pool outside, a hot tube, a tanning bed, excerise room and a tikki bar it is right on the beach. A wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at Flagship”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl417
Reviews.Content: were greeted right away at front desk, staff was friendly and available for help when it was needed, room was clean and stocked with everything needed for a weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely love staying at the Flagship”
Reviews.Author: ccerceo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed numerous times at the Flagship, Location is awesome oceanfront on the boardwalk. You literally can get anywhere you want to go without even getting in your car by using the bus and the tram car.. The staff is very friendly and helpful especially Scott the Manger and Donna in housekeeping. They have always catered to our every need. We have already booked our stay for this year and will be bringing our three grandchildren with us. The Flagship is a very family friendly hotel and we plan to vacation there for years to come. Domenick & Cheryl Philadelphia PA

Reviews.Title: “Thanks too Scott... my kids say that this hotel beats the Outer Banks.”
Reviews.Author: HallRon67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Flagship Hotel for a week with our young children. It was a very relaxing stay. The staff at this hotel was far better than any other place we have ever stayed. Scott " Manager " was a really cool guy and he made sure that our stay was worth a return visit. Thank You Scott and the entire staff of the Flagship hotel for an excellent stay. Ron and Family

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay In Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: scottyrocket60795
Reviews.Content: I stayed with young children. It was the the most accommodating trip to O.C. in a long time. I had a very nice remodeled room, with an arcade for the kids. They have tanning beds for the wife and slightly outdated exercise room for me. There was a big screen T.V. on the third floor and in the lobby where I watched NASCAR in HD. The indoor pool was closed briefly because of a childs accident but was promptly cleaned and the pool chemicals were adjusted because of it. I felt very comfortable because it got cold and as soon as we requested blankets they were there within minutes. Scott at the front desk went out of his way to do anything he could for us to make it a better stay. Kudos to him and the rest f the staff (Devon) for making us feel at home. Thanks guys we will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ocean Front Deal Directly on the Boardwalk!!”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshiper48
Reviews.Content: Leave your room, walk about 20 steps and you are in the sand! Immaculate housekeeping staff, friendly staff that will go totally out of their way to make your stay everything that you want it to be and views from every room of the breakers that are to die for. Great location right at the North end of the trolley run with a huge enclosed courtyard that is fun and safe for the children. Also a large courtyard pool overlooking the ocean. Good drinks at their pool bar too! Yes, it was built around 1980 and it is a bit retro, and yes, the elevator does not smell so good (I understand they got to the bottom of this problem and it has been fixed), but get over it - this is a great value and well run.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pass This One Up!!”
Reviews.Author: OceanCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel several times a year for the last few years. I have to say that the bad reviews I have seen on this site don't do this place justice! No, it's not the fanciest hotel on the beach, but it's oceanfront on the boardwalk, has an indoor and outdoor pool, hot tub, restaurant onsite, etc. It's right at the end of the boardwalk, which is great if you want to be near the action, but not in the middle of it. The thing that keeps me coming back is that the staff is outstanding! Scott, at the front desk, is incredibly helpful and always makes sure I get the room and the location that I want. He knows exactly who I am when I call. Donna knows both my name and my son's name and takes such great care of us from the moment we check in until even after we have checked out. I also love how they always have fresh fruit waiting for you with the coffee in the lobby. The great thing about the way this hotel is situated, is that most of the rooms have a great view of the ocean. You overlook the pool area and the ocean from most or all of the rooms. They also have a great play area for the children, safely tucked inside the courtyard, that also has picnic benches. There is also a game room and a TV room in the middle of the hotel. I have stayed at outstanding hotels all over the U.S. I have to say that the service and friendliness, I have always experienced at this hotel, surpasses that of those 5 star locations. The hotel goes through new renovations each off-season, so if you came before and didn't like your room, you should ask to try one of the newly renovated ones. You won't find 5 star rooms here, but you won't pay for a 5 star room, either. The rooms are clean and well maintained and that's all I need when I am going to the beach. Personally, I am going to be out and about all day, enjoying the beach, pools, activities, restaurants, etc. Who cares about a fancy room that you have to pay tons of money for when you should be outside enjoying all that the area has to offer? Thank you to the amazing staff at Flagship and I look forward to seeing you a few times again this year!

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: luna46410
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean, accomodating and in a great location. great deal for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “a little on the noisey side”
Reviews.Author: hd145
Reviews.Content: checked in on a sunday everything ok monday comes 8:30 in the morning saws,hammering,drilling all day you could not stay in room and get any peace tuesday and wednesday same thing it would have been great if they told us the place was under construction i would have went some where else overall place is not bad call ahead for construction schedule

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: LouisePennsylvania
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location on the North end of the Boardwalk. The lobby had a computer and complimentary fruit, coffee, & hot chocolate. The room had a microwave, refrigerator, VCR, sunlamp, comfy beds, and views of the ocean from the balcony. A guest laundry was available. The pool and hot tub were clean and refreshing. But the "fitness room" was a joke. We called just two days before arrival and were told there were free weights and a stand-alone multi-function unit. In reality, though, there were NO free weights and the the stand-alone unit was "out of order." Disappointing. Oddly, once you got off the elevator, you had to walk up then down some steps. But we didn't mind the exercise. What we did mind, however, was the smoky smell in the hallways even though we were in a smoke-free area. All-in-all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updated”
Reviews.Author: Sojourner001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel probably close to 20 years ago. Quite honestly, it doesn't look like much was done to it in those 20 years. The entire building, just really needs an overhaul. Everything worked fine, the plumbing was fine, the room was ok--just sorely in need of freshening up.

Reviews.Title: “Renovatoins Desperatley Needed But Keep the Staff”
Reviews.Author: bpattersn
Reviews.Content: Place was pretty good but it needs to be renovated. The oceanfront rooms have a fantastic view of the end of the boardwalk and the ocean. The walls are pretty thin though and I had a large family above me. The only thing that made me not hate this place was how accommodating the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: frostgto
Reviews.Content: Management was rude, Rip tIDE BAR A JOKE.. Rooms smelled, rust on bathroom fixtures, won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest hotel I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: TMWREW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Flagship Hotel on-line. The lobby area was the best part of the hotel. The first room that we had was absolutely horrible. The carpet was so stained with red stains and other stains my husband reported it. The room was so visibly nasty that I didn't even sit down while my husband reported the carpet stains. The second room smelled like mold too. The hallway carpets were disgusting and filled with mold. We checked out and still had to pay for the stay. We were told that if we had stayed overnight, and checked out, we would have had to pay for 2 nights. Never go to this hotel. It was HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: gradygirl07
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the front desk staff!!! Customer Service was good. Location is pretty good. The room was very disappointing for the price we paid. Bathroom, kitchen, and furnishings were very outdated. Bathroom was dirty and the tub would not drain (stood in water when taking a shower). Very musty smell & hallways are very narrow. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Read- find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: attyjane
Reviews.Content: I have 2 daughters 18 and 20. When we checked in the room it was filthy and my daughters refused to stay in the room. We were put into another room that smelled like mildew and did not have the air on- why it was 92 degrees outside??? I asked to get my money back and the manager would not give the money back. Therefore we spent very little time at hotel. When I made reservations I was told I was getting a newly renovated room- There was nothing new about this hotel not even the bedding was new. The air conditioning did not work well, The pool was dirty, cigarette butts everywhere, the porch furniture was disgusting - so fithy you could not sit it. I can say nothing good about this hotel and we have stayed in many hotels since my girls were little.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: smokinht22
Reviews.Content: My family went to O.C for 1 night to get away with our 2 babies I saw the flagship online the rooms looked really nice the place looked nice and for the money couldn't beat it... How wrong was I the pictures online must be from 10 years ago or more... When we got there the place was a dump the room was dirty I had to clean the whole bathroom and shower there was hair all over the place it was gross did not even want to stick my babies in the tub. The bed was horrible uncomfortable sheets dirty pillows where bunched up and not neat. We where afraid to let our youngest crawl on the floor for fear he would get something. The small kitchen it had was gross there was something all over the stove that was sticky thank god we only stayed there one night I would not recommend this place to anyone and it is expensive for another 50 dollars we could have stayed at the hilton... Oh and the parking is terrible you have to park on another block when it is crowded we had to walk in the pouring rain with 2 babies 1 block just to get to the hotel terrible... You can also hear everything in this hotel people walking talking it is so loud you can't even sleep..

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: hsybear
Reviews.Content: Location is nice. Our room had the ability to be an adjoining room and that was horrible. Neighbors had their TV on all night (not even that loud, I don't think), but our bed was situated by the "adjoining" door and their TV must have been on the opposite side...ARGH. I dreaded coming back to the room at night as I knew I wouldn't get any sleep. Nice that many rooms have "ocean view", but the set up is strange and we didn't use the balcony as I thought we might have...you were right on top of your neighbors as there is no divider, just a low railing...of course this is so they can say there are ocean views...Pools were fine and pirate ship play area is nice. Again, nice location, but the rooms need some updating and sound proofing. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: CrawfordCounty
Reviews.Content: First we arrived to Ocean City for our first time on a Tues afternoon. We found that there are very few Hotels, mainly all condos. Second there are very few Hotels Oceanfront/Boardwalk. We had just about decided to leave not finding any vacancy when we saw Vacancy at the Flagship. The Hotel was big and older looking but Oceanfront. The rates were cheaper that all surrounding hotels. We decided to stay and got an oceanview room. Getting to your room can be tricky. If you use the elevator you still have to go up 3 steps then back down 3 steps to make it to the rooms. Our room had been remodeled in the past couple or years. The View was good from the center of the building. Pirate ship playground for the kids in the courtyard and a nice outdoor pool with lounge. Indoor pool and hot tub were handy one day when it rained. On the end of the boardwalk with tram pickup and bike rental. Tram $3 per trip and you must have exact change or walk. Beach was very clean and very professional life guards on duty. There is a restaurant connected, Jonah and the whale seafood buffet. It was your average buffet except $24 per adult. Staff was A+++. Maintenance man was always opening doors and very friendly. Pool was cleaned daily. Cleaning staff kept halways sand free and windows always clean. Front desk was very courteous and when we decided to stay an extra day, moved us to another room that was ocean front. The only thing negative was that the hotel needs updated on the outside and in. I am sure that in the 70's this hotel was 1st class.

Reviews.Title: “Dont judge until you try it”
Reviews.Author: cyndybest1
Reviews.Content: So many good things we can said about a place as well as bad but first you have to live then talk about..I was just like any person searching for a nice chea place to be with my family @the beach after looking and also staying @ differnt hotel and the past i would said this much "THERE IS NO PLACE LIKE HOME" form the people the work there to the bed you sleep in the view of the ocean the pool, hot tub, the all you can eat sea food buffet you name it's there a place you can stay n relax no worry. stay for one night and ask your self did i make a right desicion? YES!! How ever dont for get this is not a hotel in VEGAS i know there are some room the need some fixing but there is nothing they can fix the room i stay in was a new remodelo about 2year ago and still look GOOD so im pretty sure on the next summer they place would be One of the most beautifull ocean front hotel in MD

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations for a ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: RayRay12
Reviews.Content: Usually when you check into an ocean front hotel, they are glad to get your money and that is it. We checked in and we were treated like we belong there. The desk clerk was very friendly and helpful. He made suggestions for dining and sites in the area. The room was pleasant, comfortable, and clean. We are retired and enjoy a relaxing enviroment. We plan on going there again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “POOR AC CIRCULATION”
Reviews.Author: prossa
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW AND ITS ENTIRETY BEFORE RESERVING.... DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE WE MADE!!!!!!!!! I still gave this hotel a chance after reading the bad reviews. I always like to experience things on my own before joining the "band wagon".. whoosh.. should have taken it more seriously when someone has mentioned about the ac unit. Let me first start off saying that this hotel has the Best CS Reps. Everyone of their staff was pleasant. It's a BIG plus there. I was told at the time of booking that we will be getting the "Deluxe" Efficiency, Newly Renovated for less than a year. I expected the best!The size of the room sucks!, my heart dropped when I entered, I was very disappointed in what I saw. It was hot and musty up on the 3rd floor. I went over to feel the ac unit, it was blowing barely nothing. I called for maintenance right away. He came and took out the tank cleaned it and replaced a new filter. Supposedly that was the cause of it blowing the warm air. I was told to give the room a few hrs and it should cool down. Okay... My husband and I took the kids for a walk on the boardwalk, came back and it was still warm. Since we are the type of people that don't like to cause a lot of inconvenience to anyone, we put up with the warmth hoping that it will get better. Later I discovered that the stove was not working on two of the 4 ranges. Called for maintenance again, since we paid a bit just to have a kitchen I was a bit upset at this time. He came fixed it. I had to spend most of my time out on the balcony during the day where this would be the only place I would get some breezy air, while my kids and hubby are at the pool. By 11p.m the next day- I have to say by this time, the ac unit must have failed to give out any cool air for good. We could not sleep. My kids were crying tossing and turning, My little girl who is only 6 mos was swetting profusely. At this time I was def fired up, I went outside and sat there until 5 in the am. I think sleepin on the balcony was better than on the bed in that sono room. Got our stuff ready and checked out at 8 a.m. This was a very awful decision I ever made. Having to pay $269 per night should have been a bit better than this. Spinnaker Motel was even better. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE......

Reviews.Title: “Can't make a mountain out of a mole hill.......”
Reviews.Author: ineedtolearntosayno
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flagship back in 2007. We had a great time. We were scheduled to stay at the quality inn this year and at the last minute another family member decided to come, so we booked two rooms at the flagship. So 2010, we stayed again. A lot has changed. In 07 they had a free breakfast which is now gone. The housekeeping came every day in 07, they didn't come in our room once in 10. In fact this year we had to put our dirty towel and trash outside the room for them to pick up. So if you don't mind sand being in your room all day, either request they clean or stay somewhere else. The air conditioning BLOWS!!!!! and not cold air. We were told if we come back to request a room on the lower levels because everyone on the third floor doesn't have good air. Needless to say we were there in the middle of the heatwave. Our TV was total static which sucked for my little ones. The maintence man came and did bring us a fan and a new TV which made us happy. So the staff did do their part to try to help us out. The second night, my mom tried to open the door to let us in and the whole handle fell off and she was trapped inside the room. I brought the door handle down to the desk and told her what happened and she laughted. Ok, third floor with ,my mom and a four and six year old in a room with a broken door....not funny. Fire hazard if you ask me. Again the maintence man had to come up again and he did fix the door but put the handle on upside down. Overall, it isn't a bad hotel for the price. There weren't any bugs, the room was clean except for the dishes, but we brought our own paper plates anyways. Will we stay there again....NO. We will save up a little more and pay for the nicer hotel. It is old, needs updated...but it does have great views and is right by the train station which is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “2nd year and bring family next year we love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbg327
Reviews.Content: this was our second year. we love this place. perfect for us. rooms are good clean comfy. All have a balcony great view!! desk and house keeping are very helpful!! only execption was sonia she was rude and changed us from the room we were told we would have to a lesser room. we got for the view my hubby loves it! ron his mom and amanda were very helpfull in fixing our rooming problem the next am. we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation was wonderful and Staff is AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Pghmom2010
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Ocean City. We traveled with my mother (a senior citizen) and two small children. I called the night before leaving for vacation because I was nervous after reading the reviews. I spoke to Scott who informed me that if there were any issues when we arrived to call the front desk immediately. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. There was NO FISH smell. The room was clean. There is everything you need to have a nice, affordable vacation with your family. The hotel is conveniently located at the end of the boardwalk and close to Jolly Rogers Amusement Park. There are fast food restuarants within walking distance. We had a great time. The bottom line is you are not paying for a 5 Star Hotel. If you want to stay a a fancy expensive hotel there is a HILTON a few doors down. Go there and spend $300 a night. I cannot say enough about the staff. The girls at the front desk were so helpful and friendly. The night manager Scott will bend over backwards to make your stay enjoyable. I was happy that we gave the hotel a chance even though other reviews were bad. We are planning a return trip in October.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel, AWESOME STAFF!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: riddlemethis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently in June during what is hailed by the locals and the rest of the World as "Senior Week". It's a rite of passage persay that high school seniors experience (a week of partying) after graduation. They were pretty wild but the staff of the hotel had an awesome response to any noise complaints. They handled it with compassion for fun yet importance of safety and respect of the other guests' in the hotel, who like me were well beyond graduating high school. My accommodations were a bit outdated but it was clean and welcoming. There was an indoor pool that was open 24 hrs, hot tub, lots of arcade games, and a giant tv in a lounge area that was looking out over the ocean. I myself dealt with the manager at night time, Scott. I had called him several days prior to coming to confront some of these other reviews. He told me like it was and also told me that if there was anything he could do to make my stay more comfortable just to ask. I did ask several times for several things (restaurant suggestions, toiletries, fun stuff to do, and just conversation about Ocean City.) I could tell that he was having a long week and was busy but he took the time to talk with me the customer for however long.....he made time, he was very informative, helpful, and down right funny. I would def go back to this hotel. Scott, as well as the other staff members, being the number one reason followed by the location and all the great amenities. In a nut shell this is an older hotel, which requires a lot of care that they provide well. If you need something no matter how bizarre or simple.............. you get it. Customer importance still exists here, earning my return business. THANKS FLAGSHIP FOR AN AWESOME VACATION AND GREAT REST!!!!!!! See you again sometime this year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: ronseandaphtravel
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the staff was fantastic!!! The hotel needs to be updated. The curtains and bed linens were very old. The bathrooms were extremely outdated. The tile was old and musty. The entire hotel had a fishy stinky odor. For a few dollars more you can stay at a better hotel and still stay within your budget

Reviews.Title: “I had a g'day and good night at the Flagship.”
Reviews.Author: foldsbaldwin
Reviews.Content: I come all the way from Australia on a trip to the east coast and one of the stops I was fortunate to make was to Ocean City, MD. I LOVED IT. Fantastic place with fantastic people everywhere you go. So I heard good things locally about a waterhole called the Flagship and decided to make that my hotel choice. When we were checking in, the cobber at the front counter, Scott was very helpful although his associate (name escapes me) seemed a few Kangaroos loose in the top paddock since he seemed to have a stunned mullet when I talked. I loved the pool but the floors can be wet (which they warn you when entering) and I ended up going a over t! My mates and I had a chuckle at that. When we got to our rooms, it wasn't in perfection condition but it was hardly a dog's breakfast as some other people say. At night we went out for drinks and got a bit plonked face but the night desk guy (again, Scott) didn't mind and laughed at me and my mate's antics. We then went up to the third floor and took use of the lovely lounge and also took advantage of the very reasonably priced soda and snack machines. The last thing I think I can add to my review is that I found the bed to be comfortable when I finally hit the sack. Next time I come to the States I am staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: BadSatin
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because it was the off season and i wanted to be on the boardwalk. They had an early booking discount code so the price was great. I got an efficiency with a king bed thinking it would be perfect and very romantic. When i got there i was informed the rates had been dropped for the year... great. I soon found out why. The room was NASTY. The carpeting was flat out disgusting being extremely stained and crusty in some areas. The bathroom was not particularly clean either. As I mentioned i was on a romantic get away with my bf that i do not get to see very often.
