The maids decided it was acceptable to not knock and just stroll right in at 8 in the morning, then again at 11 AFTER we told them no room service thanks. If there had not been a chain on the door, they would have been in for an inappropriate sight. NOT ROMANTIC to be walked in on without so much as a tap tap tap on the door. There was no privacy sign to put on the door......... The only nice thing i could say was the pool was nice... as well as the location.

Reviews.Title: “The room odor kept me awake!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover010
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and am not picky at all where I stay...Here is the truth... When we arrived to the hotel the employees were very friendly..I liked that..I almost feel bad telling you how nasty this condition of the hotel and rooms were...the lobby did have a musty odor and there were two sofas ..the sofas looked like they were from the 60's nasty and ripped around the edges..when we got to our ocean front room after passing through a hallway with sloped creaky floors ...we opened the room and found a pair of mens shoes ..lol..the room smelled alot worse than the lobby!! I left it open the whole day hoping to air it out..even the ocean could'nt remove it. The curtains were dryrotted..lol..the bedspreads were so old ..please cmon.they were from the 60's also..I didnt care about that though..It was the odor!! The odor kept me awake!! I had to pull a cover over my nose to sleep..There were four things that kept me there that night..1.The 24 hour pool..although there were two year olds in there after 11 at nite..screaming! 2.The hot tub..very nice..it was enclosed for privacy..closed at 10pm. 3.The view .although the balcony was creaky and didnt seem safe!! 4.The location right on the boardwalk.. I would not recommend taking little ones ..the outside play area was really run down ..there was glass on the ground..The picture online looks great ..but it is nothing like what you see.. Spend a few dollars more and go somewhere where you can relax and enjoy yourself

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel but could be alot better!”
Reviews.Author: Debbi32
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed one night over memorial day weekend. It was $200 a night which I didn't think was too bad. We had an ocean view room with a balcony. There were only a few things a didn't like, the entire hotel gave us a very dirty feeling. The lobby was just strange and the hallways make you feel like your on a ship. The first set of room keys we got didn't seem to work, they issued us new ones. When we got into our room it was very outdated but not bad. We were left a note in the bathroom from the hotel which stated "Due to the out of control water issues in Ocean City your water pressure and temperature will fluctuate" Which the next day we found out that means that there will be no shower pressure and either your freezing or getting burnt. I found it strange that after you shower your ceiling rains for a while, they don't have fans in the bathrooms. The room was pretty big and came with a fridge which was nice. The only other things I didn't like was that our door to the balcony didn't lock and anyone can hop over the railing into your balcony. That made me uncomfortable at night. Other then that I've stayed at worse hotels. If your over 21, I totally suggest "Seacrets" you'll have the best time and for $2.50 you can ride the bus all day!

Reviews.Title: “will never staty here again”
Reviews.Author: nanner09
Reviews.Content: Where do i start rooms were never cleaned even after we asked dead fly still on the floor whole vist nothing to eat with in the kitchen room holds 4 people 2 chairs to eat at and only 2 spoons 1 fork and 2 knives that wouldnT cut anything would not tell any friends or family to ever stay here and need to say we will NEVER STAY AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time was had by all!”
Reviews.Author: snowmandesigns
Reviews.Content: Reserved this hotel before reading any of the reviews. Read the reviews and was terribly worried. Upon arrival found the Flagship to be an older hotel but very clean and neat. We rented an efficiency room for 13 days and could not have had better service and accomodations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, not sure where these other people stayed or what they expected but must not have been the same place we stayed. Will definately book this hotel again for any of my trips to oc with family or friends. Thank you staff of the Flagship for making this a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “where is the housekeeping?!”
Reviews.Author: tjrigg
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and the kids love the pools and play areas. My husband and I like the poor bar and live music so we stayed again. It was a disaster. We found dirty socks in our bed and had to change the sheets ourselves because the housekeepers had gone for the day. My 4 year old found an open bag of cheese curls in the cabinet and was about to eat one. Thank god i caught that in time. She had no idea they weren't ours. We found a pair of sandals up in the closet between what were supposed to be the extra "clean" pillows...um lets see, our door handle broke off one day and we were locked inside the room. good thing my husband is handy and rescued us!! Best of all, i was caught in a hallway behind 2 of the housekeepers who were groping each other so much that they didn't even know i was standing there enjoying the show until i excused myself. I might have lost my cool had one of my kids been with me to witness that!! I complained several times and I was assured that it was taken care of and that we'd be taken care of upon check out...guess what...I wasn't reimbursed for a thing. I had to change my own bedding for god sake...needless to say we will not be going back there again. Shame, this used to be a pretty nice place and I'll miss that pool bar!!

Reviews.Title: “boardwalk vacation”
Reviews.Author: kathyAuburn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a great location at the far end of the boardwalk. The over all trip was great weather/and golf. The staff at this hotel was very friendly and helpful. If going to ocean city and staying on the boardwalk its 3 miles long and the train trip price is always worth the cost. I hope to return again in the further. Pulsifers, MA

Reviews.Title: “Perverts Work Here”
Reviews.Author: lollypopLongIsland
Reviews.Content: On very last day of trip, we used the pool area shower. My husband found a camera planted behind a peephole in the ceiling, He confronted the maintenance guy, who denied everything. We left abruptly and called the manager the next day from home. He denied that the showers in the pool area were in service "for the past month" and denied the possibility of a camera. My husband punched a hole in the ceiling and pulled the camera out. We have it in our possession. Detectives are working on this case. This is disgusting. Who knows how many women , children, men, anyone, are on tape after using this shower!! They are obviously all in it together and they should all be in jail!

Reviews.Title: “ehh ok i guess”
Reviews.Author: mike1438
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at this hotel last week since i had memorial day off and I'm not all that hard to impress. First the good..The location of the hotel is pretty decent its on 26th street just at the end of the boardwalk and it is basically right on the beach so you dont have to walk all that far. On the second floor they do have like a little arcade with a pool table and several different arcade games. On the third floor they had like a lounge with a decent size flat screen tv that we got to watch the hockey game on. The room was a decent size and it wasnt dirty or anything like that. We did get the room with the kitchen so there was a small fridge a microwave a stove and some dishes and a sink. The hotel staff seemed friendly but they didnt go out of their way to like say hi or anything like that, but not like i cared. Check in was at 3pm and we got there around 8am so we had to wait a while before our room was ready. Luckily they have an indoor pool and a hottub which they let us use and they also had a fitness center(which was a joke) and a tanning bed that i didnt get a chance to look at. Luckily the weather was decent so we got to lay out by the pool for a while as well. There is a bar out by the pool which i didnt get a chance to check out mainly because it was 9am and i pulled an all nighter to drive down there. When our room was finally ready it was decent like i said. It was supposed to be oceanfront and i mean you can see the ocean from the balcony from the room but its not a direct view. The courtyard they have is in a horseshoe shape but its not to bad i guess you can still see the ocean. Now the bad. The first thing we noticed was that there was virtually no water pressure in the shower. it took 15-20 minutes of messing with it and we finally improved it but the water temperature was either extremely hot or extremely cold. I went the hot route and thought my skin was going to melt off. The second day we could not get the shower to turn off so we had a maintenance man to the room and he kind of fixed it, it was alot more tolerable. then after that we went out for a while and came back and saw that the indoor pool had sprinklers goin all around it which was cool. The next day we wake up to find out that the indoor pool and hottub were closed do to maintenance and they didnt open til like 3. Also we looked outside to find the outdoor pool was being drained into the courtyard so that was flooded. The weather wasnt exactly the best so we stayed in the room for a majority of the day and went out around 5ish. The location again was good being that there are tons of resturants and places to go to. The maid did show up as we were waking up earlier in the day and we asked if she could come back later. She said that all we needed to do was put this service room please tag on the door. We did that but noone ever came back and the maid did not show up once during the entire trip so our room was never cleaned and we were forced to steal towels from the pool area. Checkout at this hotel is 11. we called down for a late checkout and they said we could stay til like 12 i believe or we could pay 30$ to stay til 6 which i did. Parking was not too bad i got a spot near the side entrance but then again we went from mon-wed and it was not crowded at all so i can only imagine how bad it gets when its busy. I believe there was also an all you can eat sea food buffet on the side of the building but we didnt go there. One other bad thing could be the walls not being all to thick. We didnt have anyone next door til the morning that we were leaving and we could basically hear everything that was said in the next room but they werent exactly going out of their way to keep it down which could be an inconvience for some. But yeah thats the trip in a nutshell overall i didnt mind the hotel but there is always room for improvement, i did no research at all in the booking of this trip it was spur of the moment and it was practically the first one i saw so im sure you could find a better hotel at a better rate if you really looked but overall i was satisfied. total came to like 228 for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,Disgusting and smelly”
Reviews.Author: mariass21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in flagship for memorial day weekend, What a nightmare!! I was given a smoke room, they said all non-smoking rooms were taken, It smelled, my room was dirty, when I pulled back the bed covers there was ashes on the bed skirt and sheets (which I took pictures of and am sending them to the health department), that just tells me that the housekeeper didn't change the sheets! We were so disappointed with this, my kids were very upset that they wanted to leave..The pictures are very deceiving! DIRTY,DIRTY, NASTY DIRTY!!!! The only good thing was the location.........

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: driley64
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay thru the internet as the rate was reasonable for off-season. The pictures are quite deceiving!!! We arrived Apr 19th for a one nite stay. Walked into the rm, took a one look at this 1960 style dump and went immediately to front desk to check-out. The staff did assist us in finding another rm on property (6-8 other hotels in all), however, we were not given the $59 room rate originally paid for our inconveinence but were charged $99 fot the Holiday Inn. Pissed me off! I now vacation in FL & CA as you can rent a prisine rm oceanfront for a whole lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Dealt With It, But Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Jeannie06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel August 25-28, 2008, and we won't go back again. Let me start out by saying that the staff is REALLY terrific!!! I had ZERO issues with them and they tried VERY hard to correct things!!!! Our room was clean...If it would not have been clean, I would not have stayed, not even for a second!!! I am the girl that bleaches her house down every weekend (totally not exaggerating, completely true!). It is a good location physically on the beach... HOWEVER, this hotel is located above an all you can eat crab/seafood buffet(Jonahs something Buffet, if you want to look it up)!!!!! If I would have known that, I would have NEVER booked it. We were informed on the first night we were there that we were placed above the kitchen ...The hallways smelled like steamed crab and the kitchen staff likes to play their music so loud that we couldn't hear our TV! We called the front desk everynight to have them tell the restaurant to turn it off! They have some efficiency rooms, ours was one of them...When people cooked food in their rooms, it would stink up the entire hallway! I could smell fried eggs in the morning and fried hamburgers at night... All cheap smelling food, nothing good! Made me gag a little! People also propped their room doors opened so when you walked down the hallway you could, not only smell their nasty food, but you could look into their nasty room with underwear on the floor, unmade beds and whatever else! I didn't understand this concept as I have never been in a hotel where people did that kind of thing. Not sure even why they did it! The walls are insanely thin! You can hear everything. We were in a room that could adjoin with the one to the right of us and the person in the other room was actually trying to unlock the door and get into ours...TOTALLY weird!!!! Needless to say, we will not be staying at this hotel again...The staff was terrific and I feel really bad to give such a low rating just for their sake. They should all get jobs at the Hilton or something up the street as that really is the caliber of service they provided. However, it isn't worth going back for at all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EEEEEK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ciaoirlanda
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing I can say about this place was Tiara one of the front desk managers!!! Thats it!! The hotel smells, the walls are paper thin between rooms, decor is foul. There was a family of cats living in the pirate ship in the courtyard where children play YUCK!!!!, OH and don't trust Travelocity when they say you are getting an Oceanview room as more then likely you will not, ring hotel in advance much safer!! Will not be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff,,,really tired building.....not up to standard.”
Reviews.Author: Bonifant
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Flagship this last weekend.....First the staff was very nice....quick w/a smile and nice word. That is the good....and now the rest......Does Aqua color tiny bathroom give you a idea how old this place is....likely built in the sixties....dark ...musty and lots of creaky noisy wood construction .....it was about as clean as you could make a worn out building...really needed everything replaced....at the end of its service life. I understand why there is no renovation ....would be a waste of good money .....the outside pool was the nicest feature.....the rest kinda left you wanting to take a shower ( usually cold water) and try to get "it" off you.. My wife is recovering from the mattress ....remember the " I Love Lucy" with the mattress and the hole in the center....it is here!! For another 50.00 dollars you can move to a 30 year newer building and not feel like something is crawling on you.....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: dippyeggs
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a pleasant vacation for the price. The rooms are used very hard, but the rooms were clean when we arrived and cleaned very well each day. The entire staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel was conveniently located at the beginning of the boardwalk. The outside pool area was very nice. The kids liked the game room and the big screen tv in the common room. We would consider returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: famvaca08
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the Flagship, my family and I were overtaken by a dirty and unpleasant smell. The terrible smell did not get any better as we got into our room. The bed linens looked very old, as well as the curtains. The room was dark and gloomy. There was a big stain on one of the pillows, I removed it from the bed of course thinking the maid would give us fresh pillow cases the next day, but she didn't. That makes me wonder how often they change the sheets and such. The hotel staff was very nice; no problems with any of them. I just feel that for the price we paid, the hotel should be kept up much better. Our room was pretty outdated, but the bathroom was clean and new. The setup of the hotel is rediculous. Our room was ocean front, and since the front desk and elevator are located closest to the street we had to carry our luggage up the steps. Reason for this is that in the middle of the hotel there are several steps (about 3 or 4) and we wouldn't have been able to get the luggage carrier over them. I don't know why they haven't replaced those steps with a ramp. After reading the other reviews, I was nervous about this hotel, and considered cancelling my reservations and going elsewhere. The hotel was not terrible- after all, it does have a 24 hour indoor pool. But unfortunately, that was about all that I really liked about it. I really don't think I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 day stay!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: n3zsr
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old granddaughter and myself had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. We had a pool view room. The view from our room of the pool, ocean and boardwalk were GREAT! The location is just a short walk (1 building) to the starting point of the tram. So it is very easy to get to the busy end of the boardwalk if you want, while staying at the quiet end. Our room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Yes the steps on the floors to get to your room is hard to manage with luggage for check in and check out. We were informed at check in that we could use either the lobby elevator or the steps from the boardwalk side of the hotel to bring in our things. They also told me if we needed help getting things in just to ask. We used the lobby to get our things in. It took us 3 trips as the 2 carts for check in were in use by other guests. When we got off the elevator with our 2nd trip of things one of the workers was in the game area and helped us, letting my husband go back down for the last few things we had in the car. There are only 2 things they could do to make the stay better. 1 put elevators on the boardwalk side of the building and put more ice machines on each floor as it is a very long walk from your room on the boardwalk side of the building to the game room area where the ice machine is. Over all this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Location”
Reviews.Author: Nittannee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicer than the older reviews would lead you to believe. We were looking for an inexpensive weekend getaway, and found a great rate on Travelocity. We stayed Friday-Sunday June 20-22 in one of the efficiency rooms. The Pros: Very clean room and bathroom was spotless. Bath and Body Works shampoo, conditioner and soap were a nice touch. Comfortable Beds Nice view of the ocean (our room overlooked the courtyard but the ocean was straight ahead) Very friendly staff The indoor and outdoor pools were nice. Nice kitchenette The Cons: Room was a little dark. Furniture on balcony needs to be replaced No onsite breakfast (coffee and fresh fruit available, though) Parking lots too small to park our midsize truck - had to park along street. All in all, we liked the location and the rate couldn't be beat for this time of year. This is fine for a frequent visitor to OC who is looking for a nice clean but basic place to stay. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: lanefiero
Reviews.Content: I was on this site before we left to go to Ocean City. I was reading some of the terrible reviews that this hotel recevied. I almost canceled our reservations at this hotel. I am certainly glad that I did not. This place is great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. It was very nice and very clean. We had a beautiful view of the ocean, the outdoor pool and the play area. The play area and the pools were very clean and well kept. The location of this hotel was also great. The staff was ****outstanding***** I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially with a family. I will stay at the Flagship again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlajo
Reviews.Content: 5 of my girlfriends and I decided last summer we wanted to start an yearly trip to OCMD. We found this place becuase we decided last minute and it was very reasonable. The hotel was a little old but for the price we paid we would go back in a second. We actually are. The rooms are large, and they have connecting rooms which are nice for larger groups. The location is wonderful. Right on the boardwalk. The rooms were clean, and while they were a little outdated very nice. The balconies on every room were large and connected so we could all hang out on the balconies in the evening without straining to fit. The outdoor pool was beautiful. Very clean. The indoor pool was not as nice but still had no problems using it. They served a simple breakfast each morning which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “just awful”
Reviews.Author: tedhoney
Reviews.Content: all I can say is that I was so so disapointed it was our 33 year Ann. get away. took the ferry from Cape May, New jersey to spend the weekend and see ocean city beaches. the hotel was awful smelly durty. just not kept up with I would not go in the pools the indoor was worst then the out door one. very very sad is see what could have been a nice hotel for the money. it was not cheep either and they would not let me get out of paying for sat. I had to stay the two nights. i really hope that the owner of the hotel read this and other reviews and does some inprovements. very dissatisfied guest

Reviews.Title: “Worst Lodging Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: jburrello
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property approx. 4 or 5 years ago when it was Best Western/Flagship Oceanfront hotel. This property greeted us with a musty smell in the lobby (hotel entrance door remained open our whole stay) and followed us to our room. The front door to the room is wood and did not give much comfort to security. No screen door for Patio Door, no shower lining for shower curtain, I have not seen a green old fashion bathroom since late 1989/1990. The linen was old, dingy in color and wringed. Have not experience that in 20 years. The day after we arrived we were scheduled for a fishing trip--needed to be up at 5:00 A.M. Since I was up all night because of the thin walls and the next door guests kept their T.V. on from the time we arrived at 2:30 P.M. until 1:35 A.M. in the morning (loud) and their romantic expisode I requested Wake-up Service from the front desk for 5:00 A.M. Needless to say, the Service called at 6:10 A.M. as we were departing our room for trip. Good thing I did not have a Conference that morning. Our room was on the 2nd Floor which we could only take the rolling butler to the Arcade Room on the 2nd Floor. We had to take our luggage and all other bags off the trolley, walk up two steps, walk down a very long hallway, down two steps and turn and go half-way down the hall to our room. We asked for a smoking room, but all signs on the door said non-smoking and no ash trays, however, front desk called and asked if the room was ok and I mentioned the non-smoking room and I was told that it was a smoking room and do not pay attention to the sign. Ash trays were not empty. I just did not feel clean in this accommodation. Also, the walls are thin and as well as the floor above where you could hear everything next door and above. One night we went out to pick up dinner early and there was no parking available upon return. I had to inquiry at the desk and found out there were two other over-flowing parking lots ajoining. I DID NOT HAVE A PLEASANT STAY AT THIS PROPERTY. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: chfrunamuk
Reviews.Content: Flagship Hotel Maryland Aug 2007 My family and I just returned from this hotel last week, not only is the staff uncooperative but they were very apathetic regarding my concerns. When the room was booked we were told that it would be oceanfront. The only way I saw the ocean was a huge lean from the balcony. The refrigerator was so overrun with ice that nothing could fit in the freezer. The patio door would not close properly which stopped the AC from working, when I contacted the maintenance staff I was told " all the balcony doors need to be replaced" and with that he departed my room. The cleaning staff left the front door to my room open while we were at the beach one day. I don't know how long it was open but there were no maids in sight. When my wife went to the front desk to speak to the manager she was greeted by an underage/underqualifed indivdual who responded with a blank stare. When the issue was pushed he said that he could call the police. The overall apperance of the hotel is marginal at best and the hallways stink of stale urine. If any one knows the parent company of this hotel could you please post it so I can contact them regarding their hotel. This is not a place that you want to spend your hard earned money on. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler88
Reviews.Content: OK to make a long story short, I booked this hotel after seeing a room that I supposedly were going to get. When we arrived, the place smelled terribly of urine, the hallways were extremely narrow and the room was full of bugs. The door to the "balcony" did not shut and was rusting. The room was dirty and the beds were hard as a rock. After not even being in this hotel an hour, we demanded a refund and got out of there. NEVER stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad. This hotel desperately needs major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: EricSStatenIslandNY
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that this used to be a Best Western property until it was recently sold and it doesn't look like new owners have any intentions of maintaining it never mind upgrading it. The whole place looks run down and poorly kept. We were fooled by Travelocity's three star rating and relatively low rates ($200 per night vs. $250 for most other chain hotels on the boardwalk ) Let me tell you, looking back I would spend the extra 50 bucks per night to get into Holiday Inn or similar. Check-in was fast and easy and parking is not a problem. However the lobby is very small, carpeting looks like it should have been replaced at least 10 years ago and there is only one elevator for the whole hotel. Our room (#116) upon entry smelled pretty bad and was smaller than we expected. Bathroom was poorly lit, fan was very loud but ineffective there is no safe. Comforters had some stains, mattresses rolled about and pillows were uncomfortable. TV had no HBO although listed in the channel line-up. Wireless internet service was spotty at best. Little or no connectivity was the message. In general. hotel staff was friendly except for our maid who asked us every morning if we wanted the room cleaned. It seemed like she just wanted us to stay in dirty rooms and use wet towels off the floor so she can take off early. There is no hotel restaurant and so obviously there is no room service. Beware because some websites are ambiguous about this fact because there is an independent restaurant downstairs (Jonah and the Whale) sublet by the hotel. It has a separate entrance. The hotel does offer continental breakfast in the lobby featuring some of the world’s worst case. There is no seating area and the lobby sign advises you to enjoy outside seating but to get there you have to walk through indoor pool over slippery floors. The entire layout of the hotel is very strange to say the least. For example to get to the outdoor pool you have to also go through indoor pool. which is on the street level so when sit there you're basically staring at the cars passing by just a few feet away. The gym is a joke it’s a small room with two old treadmills and two out four only weight machines not working. There are no barbells or dumbbells at all. There is no public restrooms in the lobby, guess what - it's also outside once you navigate your way through some disgusting laundry area. Men's room was out of order - the door was covered up with some dirty old chairs. Ladies' bathroom had no running water ! Outdoor pool is decent size but dirty. Pool steps have a huge hole in the floor where an old handrail used to be based. Nobody ever bothered to fill it. There is no running water anywhere as you enter the pool area from the sandy beach so naturally all the sand winds up in the pool which I haven't seen cleaned. Pool bar is okay but separated by long prison-like bars. Speaking of which. the whole pool area is surrounded by long bars so it looks a lot like a prison yard. :) The bar is only open from 11 am to 5 pm Drinks were acceptable and not expensive $4-$5 and It also offered junk food but we didn't dare try. One more positive that I found was the 40 cent soda in the soda machine so you can count on that. In conclusion, the only reason we rated our overall experience Okay was because we were really lucky with weather, spent a lot of time on the beach and really liked OC area with all its' restaurants and activities. This was our first time and we will definitely be back but never in a million years will we stay at Flagship even if it cost $99 per night. If you have the time look for a different hotel in this price range or move up to a higher class accommodations. By the way. this is the first time I ever bothered to write a review. We usually take at least three vacations a year and travel for business as well. I am 35 years old from NYC traveling with my wife and two preschoolers. Better Luck for you !!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times, but now we won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: NeenerPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the past 6 summers. We love the location (right on the boardwalk facing the ocean). We love that there is a nice outdoor pool, and our kids love the indoor pool / hot tub. Since the first time we stayed here, we knew it wasn't the best hotel......the first year we had a tub that wouldn't drain and took several hours to drain all of the water. The next couple of years there was no big problem.....just not the cleanest place. Last year the bigger problems began. A fire alarm sounded around maybe 10 p.m. My husband and I grabbed our two children and went to the lobby where everyone was allowed to stand / sit until the okay was given to return to our rooms. We were frightened by the whole thing, but we were told it was nothing to worry about....they thought a problem at the restaurant which is connected to the building......no fire, nothing to worry about. Then, several hours later, we were awakened from deep sleep with another fire alarm. This time our whole family was very scared and this time fire trucks came, and everyone had to leave the building in pajamas / whatever you had time to throw on. I actually saw two people trip / fall because of the rush to get downstairs and out of the building. Our children were traumatized because of the commotion. They also were crying because in the rush we left their blankies / stuffed animals in the beds. We were outside between a half hour and an hour I think around 2 or 3 a.m. From that night on, we had to pack a bag of blankets, dolls, cherished items each night before we could go to bed in case it happened again. My 4 year old daughter made me hold her hand every night in bed for at least a half an hour before she could relax and fall asleep. We were told this whole commotion was not the hotel's fault.........it was again the restaurant which had dish washers running and the heat made the alarm go off. We were never offered any discount although our sleep was interrupted twice and it affected us and our children throughout the rest of the stay. The restaurant never offered any free meal / discount for the hotel guests either. Against our better judgement, we decided to give the hotel one last chance this year. Again, we chose it because of the great location and the pools. This year when my husband called to make a reservation, the person talked him into paying a little extra each night to have a balcony that faced the ocean....the other rooms give you a partial view of the ocean, but more of a view of the pool or picnic table / shuffleboard area. As soon as we walked into this room my whole family said, "What's that smell?" We never did find out, but it wasn't a good smell. The view was nice, but our balcony had what looked like ashes all over it. We had friends and family staying at different hotels at the same time, so I decided to let them know we had arrived, but our phone had no dial tone. We reported the problems to the front desk. They immediately sent somebody up to take care of it. The ashes were swept off the balcony, but the phone was a bigger problem. The man came back three times, but couldn't fix the phone. He said he told his boss, and the boss told him the phone company would be out first thing in the morning to fix it. Well, by the third day, the phone still hadn't been addressed! I went to the front desk and complained again. I was told that I should go back up to my room and try it again because it wasn't turned on in their board. I did that, but it still didn't work, so I trudged back downstairs again. This time I was told that they would change my room. I didn't want to change my room after spending two nights in the room with the better view (even though it did smell funny!) I complained that I was having to use my cell phone (no free minutes) to make local calls that should have been free according to what the hotel advertises. I was told that she'd tell the manager, and that we could use the front desk phone in the meantime. This was very inconvenient as our room was probably as far away from the front desk as you can get. I just continued to use my cell phone. Nobody ever fixed the phone during our entire stay, a manager never addressed the issue, and they did not refund us any money. I am not a person to make a big scene over anything in order to get money back even when I think I deserve it. We checked out without complaining anymore. We just wanted to leave and head home. But, we definitely are not going back. They have lost some loyal customers.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Has Insects crawling everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: shannonWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival to the hotel, I found out that my room had insects. (in the bed and in the bathroom) Immeditately I complained to the front desk. The clerk was rude and was unwilling to help me! I requested if she could give me another room at another property or if she could reimburse. She stated that she had nothing to do with it and that i should handle the claim with her manager. Before leaving the hotel, I had asked the clerk to ask the manager to call me about my situtation. Everyday since then I have called back, and left a message for the manger to return my call. It's been five days now, i have not seen a refund nor a customer service rep has called me back. Please take my word: the hotel is dirty and the people are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shanins
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, my sister and her fiance just got back from a wonderful weekend in Oceancity. We had a great time. We had never stayed at the Flagship before and I must say that this was a great hotel. It was very nice. The staff was super friendly and I must say the only real down fall to the hotel was the carpets in the rooms had some stains on them, but yes thats from wear and tear and I understand that it is not feasible to replace carpet at the beginning of each year. We did have one incident while we were there, however, it was out of the hotels control. At 3:00 in the morning the fire alarm went off and we had to go outside and stand. There was an electrical outlet that had started smoking from a cell phone charger. A little scary. All in all our trip with the Flagship was one to be remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Flagship Oceanfront on a business trip, and would have to say it was below my expectations. Upon arrival, I found the exterior of the building to be in good repair and there was plenty of parking just off the side of the building. There is a very nice courtyard here facing the ocean- It includes a childrens play area, outdoor pool and a small bar. There are very long corridors with several steps making the 'journey' to your room difficult if you have a lot of luggage and your room is on the side opposite the parking lot. The room was a disapointment as the decor was very dated and worn, the AC unit did not cool the room very well and the room had a terrible odor-- I was given a bottle of germacide deodorizing spray after complaining to the front desk which seemed to help a bit. The bed was comfortable and the linens seemed to be fresh and clean. The bathroom was terrible- there was hair on several fixtures and even some purple grafitti on the wall behind the door- everything just needed a good scrubbing. The staff was the best feature of this hotel. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay Don't Always Believe One Or Two Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: ravens2007
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Flagship Oceanfront Hotel during springfest. I have to say this hotel has an incredible staff, and very clean rooms. I also enjoyed there 24 hour indoor heated pool. The hotel was located right on the boardwalk and ocean. My children enjoyed there gameroom and pool tables during rain while we stayed. I will only stay at this hotel when visiting ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Layla1962
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in OC. We paid an exorbitant amount of money for an oceanfront efficiency with an indoor pool. The oven door could not open so was virtually unusable. There was a cockroach in the bathroom. Most of the staff was unfriendly and not helpful. There was one exception, a very nice gentleman who gave us advice where to eat, and the maid was sweet. The indoor pool is the size of a postage stamp. Long long walk to the door. Cheap linens. I can go on and on. I will never go back. I am going back to Jersey beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: cathee127
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Flagship Hotel, Oceanfront in Ocean City, Md. It was a wonderful experience. Everything was clean and neat and the staff was so friendly and helpful. My room had a new bathroom and it felt like new beds. I slept so well. :) I even had a chance to talk with the General Manager at the front desk and he was very friendly and helpful. I told him what a nice room I had and how nice my stay was. :) I didn't have a chance to swim in the indoor pool or hot tub...but I went in and looked around and was very impressed with the cleanliness and that it was open 24 hours a day. I am hoping to get back there for another visit soon and am hoping to be able to use the pool and hot tub. I would highly recommend this hotel and it is very convenient to the boardwalk and everything that Ocean City has to offer. I think you will be as happy as I was staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Trish68
Reviews.Content: A very dirty hotel. I was almost afraid to close my eyes. No security. Very long hallways to have to carry your luggage. Don't think using a cart will help. You can only go a few feet before you have at least two or three steps. The TV was broken, the microwave didn't work, and the refrigator was also broke. It was all I could do to get the balcony door open. My oceanview room meant that if I stepped out onto the balcony (if I could get the door open, that is), and looked to my left, sure enough I could see the ocean. The last few days of our stay, the pool, hot tub, fitness room and tanning bed were closed because of glass breakage. The breakfast each day consisted of rotten bananas or donuts. No milk. Only juice. The hotel's website advertisement is quite false.

Reviews.Title: “smells like urine”
Reviews.Author: sdrfdfsfdsfdsf
Reviews.Content: I was down in Ocean City, Maryland for about 5 months for business. I stayed at multiple hotels and multiple times at this Best Western. I've stayed at the typical guest room and suite room (4 different rooms so far). Every room smells! As do the lobby/corridor/parking lot. In the parking lot, there is a puddle of water from the dumpster every day! No one cleans it. (and i've been staying there for 3 weeks now) There were also bug (not fruit flies but similar) in the restrooms of two of the rooms and just disgusting! Service isn't too bad. One of the rooms had a broken TV... Any button on the remote would turn the tv on or off. Can't change channels, can't adjust volume. Just on and off... But that was in one of the suites with two tv's so i just watched tv in the bedroom... In conclusion: Even if you plan on spending 90% of your time outside this hotel, I would still not recommend it. I personally would only be willing to pay about $50 for this place...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: eyegal501
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. The service was excellent!! I could not ask for a better location to the beach. Very convenient!! Will definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. I was really scared after reading the past reviews. However, it was very clean and had all the essentials. The outdoor pool is really nice. The indoor pool was also nice. It was really convenient having the poolside snack bar. The food at the snack bar was very good. All in all my family and I had a great time and plan to go back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel we came on to here and we were horrifid with the responses we saw. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk ladies were very friendly and even changed our room and dropped the prices about 80 dollars. When we got to our room, we were very very happy, the room was very big, bathroom was very clean, view was wonderful. The room did smell like smoke a little but after having the door open while unpacking, it went away. The only complaint I can think of was the hot water. It was actually scolding, but we flushed the toilet and that helped alot. As far as the hotel goes, yes it is out dated, but who really spends alot of time looking at the hotel. The carpets were clean, the pool was great, tanning bed was awesome for when it rained. The hot tub was very nice also. All in all. the hotel was great, view was great, stay was great, we will definatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: cnft
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving for 2 nights. It was off-season with amazing ocean views - we could not believe the price at $35!!! For oceanfront anywhere including Ocean City, that is amazing - even in November. The walls are very thin and I could not tune out even regular talking in the next room. The hotel needed a good cleaning and a renovation - it could be very nice if they did these things. Even at this amazing rate, I would not stay there again. At the very least, I need to be able to sleep where I am staying. On a side note, we had another wonderful dinner at Phillip's - crab au gratin is the BEST, and an amazing breakfast at the Bayside Skillet - Mimosas, Strawberries in Heavy Whipping Cream, and we split a Crab and Cheese omelette. Best breakfast I have ever had!!

Reviews.Title: “One Word ""roaches"”
Reviews.Author: CSO313
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is I stayed there once in my life and that is all I will ever stay at this hotel. The morning after our first night here I woke up in the morning to the screams of my wife. She was going to get into the shower and it had roaches coming all out of the shower drain. "Thats all I have to say about that" as FOREST GUMP once said.

HotelInfo.Name: Flagship Hotel Oceanfront
HotelInfo.Address: 2600 Baltimore Avenue, Boardwalk and 26th Street, Ocean City, MD 21842
